fullText: This gorgeous and heartrending production — about a boy and his beloved horse, separated by the first World War — achieves that most elusive of theatrical goals: it makes you believe in something that isn't there.
dtliExcerpt: This gorgeous and heartrending production — about a boy and his beloved horse, separated by the first World War — achieves that most elusive of theatrical goals: it makes you believe in something that isn't there.
bwwExcerpt: It takes a team of strong but sensitive puppeteers to bring Joey, a half-Thoroughbred who is sold into a World War I cavalry regiment, to life-size life. And it is how Joey is summoned into being, along with an assortment of other animals, that gives this production its ineffably theatrical magic...it's Joey and the mighty Topthorn who have the most complete personalities and who keep us watching as the plot plods on.
